section.title: Java Development Kit (JDK)
section.para: You must have the following JDK installed in order to build the project:
Remember to ensure that "javac" and "java" are in your path (or symlinked).
section.programlisting:
JAVA_HOME=/location/to/javahome export JAVA_HOME
PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH export PATH

section.title: Apache Ant
section.para: You must have Apache Ant 1.8.2+ installed on your system.
Remember to ensure that "ant" are in your path (or symlinked).
section.programlisting:
ANT_HOME=/location/to/anthome export ANT_HOME
PATH=$ANT_HOME/bin:$PATH export PATH

section.title: Apache Ivy
section.para: The IronJacamar project uses Apache Ivy for dependency management.
Apache Ivy is automatically downloaded and included in the development environment, so no additional setup is required.

section.title: Git
section.para: You must have Git installed on your system.
Remember to ensure that "git" are in your path (or symlinked).

section.title: Creating a patch
section.para: Our user guide explains in the "I would like to implement a feature" section how to get started on a writing a new feature or submitting a patch to the project.
You should develop your feature on a Git branch using
Once you are done you will need to rebase your work with the latest master
section.programlisting: git fetch upstream git rebase -i upstream/master
section.para: You will need to resolve any conflicts of course. Note, that all pull requests must be rebased against upstream master in order to get merged.
Then push the feature to your repository
Go to your account on GitHub.com and submit a pull request via the "Pull request" button
Remember to select the correct branch, fill in the subject with a short description of the feature, and fill in the description with the full description of the feature.
If your feature / bug-fix applies to multiple branches you will need to submit multiple pull requests - one pull request per branch.
